result.execSummary:
The defendant John N Lulich III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31. 
Bond money posted in 13CF250, 13CF251 and 14CF5 to be applied to Restitution. The balance is to be paid within the first 6 months of Probation.

10/13/14 AMENDED: RESTITUTION ORDER FILED IN THE SUM OF $550.24.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid within 18 months of Probation.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Court banks 9 months in the county jail to be used at the discretion of the Probation Agent upon Court approval.

01/12/2015 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE RELEASED FOR HUBER AND WORK RELEASE PRIVILEGES AS WELL AS WORK SEARCH EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATLY.
